comments:
Marketing 235 relies on concepts and theories of advertising as they apply to the strategic decisions of an advertising or brand manager, with emphases on product positioning, the communication process, and the measurement and evaluation of advertising effects. 
	
Many students found the class to be “fun” and “great.” However, students also found class structure to be “disorganized” and in some ways “like MKTG 101 with an advertising spin, but not in depth at all.”

Most students thought Professor Adams was very “enthusiastic” and “able to generate students’ interest.” Students also complained that Professor Adams' slides and bulk pack were not very accessible and organized, as well as that he did not always discuss the material in sufficient detail.

Throughout the semester, the course requires several individual written assignments and an advertising plan for a new or an existing product. Overall, the class “provided a good overview of the basic concepts of advertising.”
